text: is an ancient Japanese martial art.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Jū- jutsu" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 435. This form of martial arts uses few or no weapons at all and includes throws, holds, and paralyzing attacks against the enemy. Jujutsu developed from the warrior class around the 17th century in Japan. jujitsu. (n.d.). Britannica. Retrieved March 23, 2022, from https://www.britannica.com/sports/jujitsu == History == The systems of unarmed combat which were developed and practiced during the Muromachi period known as . For example, a samurai might defend himself with jujutsu if he was without his swords. ==Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Judo ==References== Category:Japanese martial arts
title: Jujutsu
